result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Durraund Viverette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possess Dangerous Weapon-Person < 18, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.60(2)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber for work, counseling and treatment release

miscConds.notes:
No contact directly or indirectly with any known illegal drug users or residences known for drug use. 
No contact with victim, residence or victim's family.
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not associate with those who possess illegal controlled substances.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
Provide DNA sample.

If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis Durraund Viverette

records.addlTxt:
11:08 AM Defendant Curtis Durraund Viverette in court, in custody.  Attorney Solomon H Gatton in court for Curtis Durraund Viverette.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights on file.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
State's recommendation - Deft to plead to amended Count 1 and Counts 2 & 3 as previously charged for 2 yrs Jail imposed/stayed in favor of Probation with the length left up to the Court, but no additional conditional Jail due to length of time that Deft has already served. 
Amended Information filed.
Deft pleads No Contest to Counts 1, 2 & 3 - Court finds Guilty of Counts 1, 2 & 3. 
Court accepts Amended Information.
Atty Gatton prepared to proceed to sentencing at this time.
State makes sentencing argument.
Atty Gatton agrees with State, but requests expungement pending successful completion of Probation.
Deft makes statement to Court.
Court orders 6 months jail on each Count with Huber for work, counseling and treatment, consecutive to each other and any other sentence. Imposed and stayed in favor of 2 years Probation on each Count with conditions as stated on the record. 96 days credit if revoked on Count 1.
State will remain silent on Expungement.
Court will not grant Expungement for reasons stated on the record.

Jury Instructions

Jury Instructions

Jury Instructions

Jury trial on October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Email communication.  From Judge to Counsel re; jury trial demand including dates for plea/motion hearing and jury trial
